data.title: Nvidia's Strategic Investment Shift: Intel and Nokia Stocks Surge
data.description: Nvidia has invested nearly $9 billion in Intel and Nokia, both of which have experienced significant stock price increases since early September 2025. data.title: TeraWulf Reports Revenue Growth Amid Expanding Losses in 2025
data.description:
TeraWulf, a Nasdaq-listed Bitcoin mining company, announced its financial results for 2025, revealing a revenue of $168.5 million, marking a 20.3% increase from the previous year. According to BlockBeats, the growth includes $16.9 million from its newly launched HPC leasing business. Despite the revenue increase, the company reported a net loss of $661.4 million for the year, with an adjusted EBITDA loss of $23.1 million.

TeraWulf has labeled 2025 as a 'turning point year,' having secured long-term data center leases covering 522 megawatts of critical IT load. These contracts are expected to generate over $12.8 billion in customer revenue, supported by $6.5 billion in financing for its HPC platform development. In the fourth quarter, the company's digital asset revenue declined to $26.1 million due to decreased Bitcoin production and prices, while HPC leasing revenue rose to $9.7 million.

The company's strategy is increasingly focused on AI and cloud computing clients, with key operations centered in the Lake Mariner campus in New York and the Abernathy HPC campus in Texas. Earlier this month, TeraWulf acquired brownfield infrastructure in Kentucky and Maryland, adding approximately 1.5 GW of capacity.

data.title: Nintendo to Reduce Strategic Shareholdings by ¥300 Billion
data.description: Nintendo is set to reduce its strategic shareholdings by approximately ¥300 billion, according to a report by Reuters. Bloomberg posted on X that the move involves shares owned by its partner banks. This decision is part of Nintendo's broader strategy to streamline its financial operations and focus on core business activities. The company has not publicly commented on the specifics of the shareholding reduction or the timeline for its implementation. The reduction in shareholdings is expected to impact Nintendo's financial relationships with its partner banks, although the exact implications remain unclear. This strategic move aligns with Nintendo's ongoing efforts to optimize its asset management and enhance shareholder value.

data.title: South Korean Carbon Permit Prices Reach Highest Level Since April 2023
data.description: South Korean carbon permit prices have surged to their highest level since April 2023. Bloomberg posted on X that this increase is attributed to investors factoring in a tighter demand and supply balance due to recent policy changes. The adjustments in policy have led to expectations of a more constrained market, driving up the prices of carbon permits. This development reflects the ongoing adjustments in the carbon market as stakeholders respond to regulatory shifts.

data.title: Binance to Conduct Wallet Maintenance for BNB Smart Chain
data.description:
According to the announcement from Binance, the platform is set to perform wallet maintenance for the BNB Smart Chain (BEP20) on 2026-03-02 at 06:00 (UTC). This maintenance is expected to last approximately one hour. During this period, deposits and withdrawals on the BNB Smart Chain (BEP20) will be temporarily suspended starting from 2026-03-02 at 05:55 (UTC). However, trading of tokens on the network will remain unaffected.

Binance assures users that all technical requirements will be managed by the platform, ensuring a smooth process. Once the network is deemed stable post-maintenance, deposits and withdrawals will be reopened. The announcement emphasizes that no further updates will be provided regarding the maintenance status. Users are encouraged to rely on the original English version of the announcement for the most accurate information, as there may be discrepancies in translated versions.

data.title: IoTeX releases IIP-56 proposal: Deprecates CIOTX and opens up 1:1 claims for IIOTX exchange.
data.description: IoTeX has released its IIP-56 governance proposal, proposing to completely deprecate CIOTX on the Ethereum, Base, and Solana networks and permanently shut down related cross-chain bridges. This follows an attack on the ioTube cross-chain bridge on February 20th, which resulted in unauthorized issuance of CIOTX on the Ethereum network; such anomalous minting will not be recognized. According to the proposal, compliant holders must submit their transaction hashes through the official claims portal. After verification, IOTX will be distributed to the IoTeX mainnet at a 1:1 ratio. The BSC, Polygon, and IoTeX mainnets were not affected by the anomalous issuance; their cross-chain bridges will be temporarily restarted after audits are completed, allowing users to migrate back to IOTX, before being permanently decommissioned. Simultaneously, the project team will notify centralized and decentralized exchanges and DeFi protocols to remove CIOTX integrations.

data.title: Federal Reserve Faces Inquiry Over Building Renovations
data.description: The Federal Reserve is currently in a standoff with a federal prosecutor over requests for information concerning the renovations of two historic buildings at its headquarters in Washington. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the ongoing tension between the central bank and legal authorities. The prosecutor is seeking details about the refurbishment projects, which have raised questions regarding transparency and oversight. The Federal Reserve has yet to provide the requested information, leading to a stalemate in the investigation. The outcome of this inquiry could have implications for the central bank's operations and its relationship with federal oversight bodies.

data.title: Japan to Invest ¥250 Billion in Domestic Chipmaking Initiative
data.description: The Japanese government has announced a significant investment of ¥250 billion ($1.6 billion) in Rapidus, a state-backed company, as part of Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s commitment to enhance domestic chip production. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the government's strategic move to strengthen its semiconductor industry amid global supply chain challenges. This investment is aimed at bolstering Japan's technological capabilities and ensuring a stable supply of chips, which are crucial for various industries. The initiative reflects Japan's broader efforts to secure its position in the global tech landscape and reduce dependency on foreign chip manufacturers. The funding will support research and development, as well as the establishment of new manufacturing facilities, contributing to the country's economic growth and technological advancement.

data.title: Currency Traders Anticipate Stronger Yuan by Year-End
data.description: Currency traders are increasingly betting on a stronger yuan, with expectations for the currency to reach 6.50 per dollar by the end of the year. Bloomberg posted on X that this shift follows signals from the People’s Bank of China indicating a greater tolerance for yuan appreciation. The move in currency-option markets reflects growing confidence in the yuan's potential to strengthen against the dollar. Traders are adjusting their positions in anticipation of this change, driven by the central bank's recent actions and statements. The yuan's potential appreciation is seen as a significant development in the currency markets, influencing trading strategies and economic forecasts.

data.title: The ETF Store President: Overall holdings of spot Bitcoin ETF investors are stable, with net inflows exceeding $1 billion in the past three days.
data.description: Nate Geraci, president of The ETF Store, stated that spot Bitcoin ETF investors' overall holdings have remained relatively stable during the recent Bitcoin price correction. Data shows that since Bitcoin hit its all-time high in early October, spot Bitcoin ETFs have experienced a net outflow of approximately $6.5 billion. However, compared to the $55 billion in net inflows attracted since January 2024, the outflow is relatively limited. Geraci also pointed out that spot Bitcoin ETFs have recorded over $1 billion in net inflows in the past three days.
